questions.question: I wish I ___ taller.
questions.explanation: Use 'were' for all subjects in wish statements (subjunctive mood).

questions.question: If only I ___ more time, I would travel the world.
questions.explanation: 'If only' + past simple for present unreal situations.

questions.question: I wish it ___ raining. I want to go outside.
questions.explanation: Use past simple (weren’t) for present wishes.

questions.question: He wishes he ___ the exam last week.
questions.explanation: Use past perfect for wishes about the past.

questions.question: If only she ___ how to swim!
questions.explanation: 'If only' + past simple for unreal present.

questions.question: They wish they ___ more money when they were younger.
I wish you ___ so noisy all the time.
If only I ___ my keys at home!
questions.explanation: Regret about the past — use past perfect.

questions.question: She wishes she ___ how to drive.
questions.explanation: Use past simple for present unreal wish.

questions.question: If only we ___ earlier, we wouldn’t be late now.
questions.explanation: 'If only' + past perfect for regrets in the past.

questions.question: I wish I ___ there with you now.
If only he ___ me before making that decision.
questions.explanation: Past perfect after 'if only' for past regrets.

questions.question: They wish it ___ snow more often in winter.
If only I ___ more confident when speaking English.
She wishes she ___ the truth.
questions.explanation: Past perfect for a past wish.
